content.en: The universe is big. It's very, very big. And every day, every hour, every second, it gets bigger!
content.tw: 宇宙非常大，而且每天、每小時、每秒鐘一直在變大。

content.en: There's a lot to learn about the universe. There are millions and billions of places in it! Scientists are learning more about it all the time!
content.tw: 宇宙還有很多我們不知道的事，科學家一直學到新的宇宙知識。

content.en: Some scientists explore the universe with telescopes. Others use robots that take photos. And some brave scientists travel to space! These brave scientists are astronauts.
content.tw: 有一些科學家用望遠鏡探索宇宙，也有科學家用機器人拍照，還有勇敢的科學家上太空成為太空人。

content.en: Only American astronauts have walked on the moon. But that's going to change! Space travel includes more people now.
content.tw: 目前只有美國太空人在月球漫步，但很快會有越來越多人參與太空飛行。

content.en: In a few years, a Japanese astronaut will walk on the moon! This will be an important moment in our history. It will be the first time a non-American astronaut walks on the moon!
content.tw: 再過幾年，日本的太空人就會在月球漫步。這會是人類歷史的重要時刻，他會是第一位非美國太空人在月球漫步。

content.en: That's not all! Next year, an American spaceship will fly around the moon. The astronauts include the first Black man, the first woman, and the first non-American to fly around the moon.
content.tw: 明年還有一艘美國的太空船會環繞月球，這項任務將讓大家看到第一位繞月球的黑人太空人、女性太空人跟非美國籍的太空人。

content.en: More astronauts are included in space travel now. This is an important time for our world and the universe!
content.tw: 現在有更多的太空人參與太空旅行。這對我們的世界和宇宙來說都是一個重要的時刻！

vocabulary.preface: 科學家的太空知識越來越豐富，太空探險也在增加。

content.text:
1. astronaut 太空人
Listen to this. 你聽這個。
Why couldn't the astronaut book a room on the moon?
為什麼太空人訂不到月球上的房間?

I don't know. Why? 我不知道。為什麼?

2. travel 旅行
Because it was full! 因為是滿月!
Okay, that's a good one. 好吧，很好笑。
But isn't it cool? 不是很酷嗎?
Traveling to the moon? 去月球旅行?

3. brave 勇敢的
Probably. But it's really too far away. 也許吧，不過那真的太遠了。
I'm not that brave. 我沒有那麼勇敢。

4. space 太空
I'm afraid I'll die of loneliness.我恐怕會死於寂寞。
Why are you worried about that? 你怎麼會擔心那個?
Because I'll be in empty space! 因為我會在空空的太空裡!

brave勇敢的

content.en: In some places, earthquakes happen a lot. In these places, it's important for buildings to be safe during earthquakes. Engineers need to build strong and steady buildings.
content.tw: 有一些地區常常發生地震，所以這些地區的建築物必須堅固、穩定。

content.en: Taiwan had a strong earthquake on April third. Most buildings were fine!
content.tw: 台灣在4月3號發生大地震，但大部分的建築物都沒事。

content.en: Taipei 101 was fine too. It's one of the tallest buildings in the world! It was built to be very strong, even during earthquakes.
content.tw: 世界最高建築物之一的台北101也沒事，發生地震的時候，101還是很堅固。

content.en: Engineers made Taipei 101 flexible. That means the building can move from side to side. This is important during earthquakes.
content.tw: 工程師建造台北101的時候，確保它有韌性，這在地震的時候很重要。

content.en: Taipei 101 has a very big, shiny ball. This ball is 660 tons! It's inside the building! And it's near the top! It can move from side to side. When the building moves to the left, the ball moves to the right. This helps keep the building safe and steady during an earthquake!
content.tw: 台北101靠近頂樓的位置有一顆很大的球，重達660噸。它會移動，當台北101向左邊晃的時候，這顆球就會向右移動，讓這棟摩天大樓穩定下來。

content.en: During the earthquake, Taipei 101 moved from side to side. But it stayed strong!
content.tw: 地震發生的時候，台北101會搖晃，但是還是很堅固。

content.en: Engineers can make buildings that are safe even when the earth shakes. Hmmm… can they stop the earth from shaking?!
content.tw: 工程師可以建造在地震中也能安全的建築物。嗯… 他們能阻止地球搖晃嗎？！

vocabulary.preface: 台北101大樓的阻尼器，讓它在地震中屹立不搖。

content.text:
1. building 建築物
Oh no, what's this? 糟糕，這是什麼?
It's an earthquake! Get down! 地震，蹲下來!
Oh my God! Is the building going to fall? 老天爺啊，這棟樓會不會垮啊?

2. safe 安全的
No, we should be safe.不會，我們應該很安全。
There, it has stopped. 好了，停了。
It was so scary! 太可怕了!
My heart is beating like crazy! 我的心臟還在狂跳!

3. shake 搖晃
I know. It was a big one. 我知道，好大的地震。
The ground was shaking from side to side. 地板先是左右晃。

4. happen 發生
Right, and then up and down.對，然後上下搖。
Let's turn on the TV and see what happened.我們來開電視看看是怎麼回事。

vocabulary.postscript:
Please read these words with me.
building建築物
safe安全的
shake搖晃
happen發生

options: b. Move from side to side

options: c. Moved from side to side

title: Working at the Penguin Post Office

content.en: Five people from the U.K. got amazing summer jobs. From November to March, they're going to work in Antarctica!
content.tw: 五個英國人得到一份很棒的暑期工作。從十一月到明年三月，他們要在南極洲工作。

content.en: The jobs are at the Penguin Post Office! It's the farthest post office to the south! One thousand five hundred penguins live outside it!
content.tw: 他們會在南極企鵝郵局工作，這間是全世界最南邊的郵局，還有1500隻企鵝在周圍生活。

content.en: About 18,000 people visit every summer! They're cruise ship passengers. They send 80,000 letters and postcards!
content.tw: 每年夏天，大約有1萬8千名搭郵輪的遊客會拜訪南極，寄出大約8萬封的信件跟明信片。

content.en: Life at the post office is an adventure. It snows every day so they shovel lots of snow! There's no running water. They empty the toilet every day.
content.tw: 在這個郵局生活本身就是一場冒險。員工每天都需要剷雪。那裡沒有水，所以每天都要清理馬桶。

content.en: Cruise ships come a few times a week. They give the workers drinking water. The workers take showers on the ships! Ahhhhh…
content.tw: 郵輪每周會來幾次提供飲用水，郵局員工也可以到郵輪上洗澡。

content.en: The penguins are the best part of the job. The workers count them! The worst part is smelling penguin poop day and night! Peeeyuuuu!
content.tw: 這份工作最棒的地方是企鵝，員工每天都會數企鵝，但最糟糕的是白天晚上都會聞到企鵝的大便。

content.en: The five new Penguin Post Office workers are going to have an amazing Antarctic adventure!
content.tw: 這五位企鵝郵局新員工將會有一場精彩的南極冒險！

vocabulary.preface: 在企鵝郵局工作，可能沒有想像中那麼好玩。

content.text:
1. visit 拜訪
I'm so ready for my summer vacation! 我完全準備好過暑假了! Do you plan to visit friends? 你計畫去拜訪朋友嗎? Friends in Penghu.澎湖的朋友。

2. amazing 驚人的
The ocean is very beautiful there. 那裡的海非常美麗。Sounds amazing! 聽起來真棒! It really is. 確實是。

3. day and night 白天夜晚
And I'd like to swim there day and night. 我白天晚上都要在那裡游泳。Sleeping outside under the moon. 睡在外面月光底下。

4. outside 外面
Sleeping outside by the sea? 睡在外面的海邊? Yeah, the sea will be shining, and you'll hear the waves. 對啊，海面閃閃發光，還聽到海浪聲。Wow!

vocabulary.postscript:
你暑假想去哪裡?
visit拜訪
amazing驚人的
day and night白天夜晚
outside外面

content.en: Hey kids, the storyteller is here! It's story time!
content.tw: 嗨，小朋友們，說故事時間到囉！

content.en: In Pakistan, many poor kids can't read. Many don't go to school. There's nothing to do. Some kids get into trouble...
content.tw: 巴基斯坦很多家境貧窮的小朋友不會認字，也不去學校。平常沒有事情可以做，有一些小朋友就會闖禍。

content.en: In one city, some people want these kids to love reading.
content.tw: 其中有一個城市，有一群人想要讓小朋友愛上閱讀。

content.en: These people wrote fun picture books. They also got some old ice cream bikes. These bikes have a big, strong box to hold ice cream. But now they hold lots of books. The bikes are cute, colorful little libraries!
content.tw: 這些人寫了有趣的繪本，還找了用來賣冰淇淋的腳踏車，這種車都有堅固的大箱子可以裝很多書，變成小型圖書館。

content.en: Storytellers ride the bikes. They go to poor parts of the city. They find a good place for reading. They put colorful little mats on the ground. They put orange safety cones around the mats.
content.tw: 說書人騎著單車，到貧窮的區域，找個好地方，在地上鋪小地毯，周圍放橘色的三角錐，開始說故事。

content.en: Every time, lots of kids come. They sit on the mats. The storyteller reads. He holds the book high. The kids listen to every word! They look at every picture! Their eyes shine! They smile and laugh!
content.tw: 每次都有很多小朋友過來坐在地毯上聽故事，說故事的人都會把書舉高，讓小朋友看到圖片。小朋友的眼神都閃閃發光，也笑得很開心。

content.en: Some of these kids go to school now. They want to learn how to read. Storytelling can change lives!
content.tw: 這些孩子中，有些現在會去上學了。他們想學習如何閱讀。說故事可以改變人生！

vocabulary.preface: 巴基斯坦有一群人，想出辦法鼓勵小孩閱讀。

content.text:
1. poor 貧窮的
Once upon a time, there was a poor boy… 從前有一個窮小子…
Wait, are you telling me a story? 等一等，你在跟我講故事嗎?
Yeah, this is a story I wrote. 是啊，這是我自己寫的故事。

2. listen to 聆聽
Do I have to listen to it? 我一定得聽嗎?
Do you have anything better to do? 你有更好的事要做嗎?
Well, not really.倒也沒有。
In that case, please let me go on. 既然那樣，拜託讓我繼續。

3. read 閱讀
But I prefer reading it myself. 但是我比較想要自己看。
It's not done yet. 我還沒寫完。

4. word 字
How many words have you got? 你寫了幾個字了?
About 20. 大概20個。
That's just 3 or 4 sentences! 那才三四個句子。
Like I said, it's not done. 我說了還沒寫完嘛。

vocabulary.postscript:
請注意，讀單字時間。
poor貧窮的
listen to聆聽
read閱讀
word字

2. What's in the big boxes now?
3. Why do some of these kids go to school now?
options: c. To learn how to read

title: Dragon Boat Racing in Alabama, USA!

content.en: Huh? What's that sound? That's right. Today is the Dragon Boat Festival!
content.tw: 那是什麼聲音?今天是端午節!

content.en: That sound is a drum. The drum helps the people racing in a dragon boat. Those people are paddlers. They use paddles to move the boat. They paddle by listening to the drum on their boat.
content.tw: 那是龍舟上的鼓聲，龍舟上的鼓可以幫助選手比賽，他們會跟著鼓聲節奏划手裡的槳。

content.en: But this isn't in Taipei. Taichung? Nope. Kaohsiung? Nope. Yilan, Hualien, Pingtung, Hsinchu, or Penghu? Nope, nope, nope, nope, and nope!
content.tw: 但這裡不是台北，台中呢?高雄，不是。宜蘭，花蓮，屏東，新竹還是澎湖。不!都不是，不是台灣任何一個地方。

content.en: This is in the USA! This state is Alabama. People in Alabama are racing dragon boats! That's really cool.
content.tw: 這是在美國阿拉巴馬州舉行的龍舟競賽。

content.en: Now many people in Alabama think racing dragon boats is fun and cool! That's great, right? People all around the world are enjoying the dragon boat festival like we do in Taiwan.
content.tw: 因為越來越多在阿拉巴馬州的人覺得划龍舟比賽很好玩又很酷。世界各地的人都像我們一樣慶祝端午節。

content.en: Today, people everywhere will be watching dragon boat races, balancing eggs for luck, and eating tasty zongzi! … Oof, I think I've eaten enough zongzi for one day … Happy Dragon Boat Festival, everyone!
content.tw: 今天，世界各地的人們都會觀看龍舟賽，立蛋祈福，並享用美味的粽子！… 哎呀，我想我今天粽子吃夠了… 祝大家端午節快樂！

vocabulary.preface: 遠在天邊的美國阿拉巴馬州，也會舉行划龍舟大賽。

content.text:
1. people 人們
Somebody is playing drums.有人在打鼓。
Not somebody. It's a whole bunch of people playing.不是一個人，是一群人在打。

2. sound 聲音
The sound is coming from the school next door. 這個聲音是從隔壁學校傳來的。
Oh, so it's probably a class. 所以那些人也許在上課。

3. drum 鼓
Yeah, they are playing African drums. 沒錯，他們在打非洲鼓。
You know how to play? 你也會嗎?
Yeah, I took classes for a while.對，我以前上過一陣子課。

4. fun 樂趣
Did you have fun? 覺得好玩嗎?
I did. I had lots of fun. 好玩，很好玩。
The best thing was I played drums on a boat! 最好的是我在船上打鼓。

vocabulary.postscript:
想想看怎麼用這些單字?
people人們
sound聲音
drum鼓
fun樂趣

2. What moves the boats?
3. What do the paddlers listen to?
options: c. The drum on their boat

content.en: Marathons are very long runs. They're about 42 kilometers long! Many people never run a marathon. But one British man ran 385 marathons in less than a year!
content.tw: 馬拉松是一種長跑的運動，全程差不多42公里。很多人從來沒有跑過馬拉松，但有一個人一年內跑了385場馬拉松!

content.en: This British man ran in Africa. He ran from the most southern place to the most northern place. He ran through 16 countries.
content.tw: 這位英國男子從非洲的最南端跑到最北部，一共經過16個國家。

content.en: He had some problems during the run. Somebody stole his money and phone. He got very sick from eating some bad food. In the Sahara desert, he ran in sandstorms and... snowstorms!
content.tw: 跑步的過程遇到許多困難，有人偷了他的錢包跟手機，他也曾經吃壞肚子。在撒哈拉沙漠，他還遇到沙塵暴跟暴風雪。

content.en: The man ran for two charities. One charity helps young people who have no homes. The other helps Indigenous people in the Sahara desert. People around the world gave them money because he ran. They gave over one million British pounds. That's over $42 million Taiwan dollars!
content.tw: 全世界的人都因為他捐款給兩家慈善機構，一家幫助無家可歸的青少年，另一家幫助撒哈拉沙漠的原住民，募款金額超過100萬英鎊，相當於4200多萬台幣。

content.en: This man ran across Africa to help people. What a great guy!
content.tw: 這位男子跑遍非洲是為了幫助人們。真是個了不起的人！

vocabulary.preface: 長跑一萬六千多公里，不只是挑戰自我，也是為了做善事募款。

content.text:
1. sick 生病
Hey, there's a marathon in Taipei next month! 台北下個月有馬拉松!
Last time you ran a marathon, you came back on the MRT.
上次你跑馬拉松，是坐捷運回來的。
That's because I got sick.那是因為我生病了。

2. kilometer 公里
From running too hard.因為你跑太用力。
From eating too much. 因為我吃太多。
This time I'll join the beginner's group. 這回我要加入初學者那一組。
That's still 10 kilometers. 那還是有十公里。

3. less than 少於
No, it's less than that. It's 5 kilometers.不到那麼多，只有五公里。
Five?! You might as well walk. 五公里?乾脆用走的好了。

4. never 絕不
I'd never do that. I'd run all the way. 我絕不會那麼做。我會全部用跑的。

你還記得今天的單字嗎?
sick生病
kilometer公里
less than少於
never絕不

quiz.question: 3. What happened to the man?

content.en: Do you look at the sky at night? Well, one night in California, people saw a big, bright light. It zoomed across the sky. Maybe it was a plane or a shooting star. But… it was Falling to the Earth!
content.tw: Do you look up at the night sky? One night in California, people saw a very bright light streaking across the sky. It could be a plane or a meteor. But it fell to the earth!

content.en: Later, scientists said it was a piece of a rocket. Pieces of broken or old rockets and satellites are space junk. Later, scientists said it was a piece of a rocket. Debris from old rockets and satellites are all space junk. Millions of pieces of space junk zoom around the Earth. The pieces can zoom 28,000 kilometers an hour! They're a big problem! Space junk can hit satellites or spaceships.
content.tw: It can move as fast as 28,000 kilometers per hour and may hit satellites or spacecraft.

content.en: Sometimes space junk falls to the Earth. Scientists said the space junk falling over California was about 1,500 kilograms! But no one found it. Metal becomes very, very hot when it falls to the Earth. Maybe the space junk burned up!
content.tw: Scientists said The space junk in California weighs 1,500 kilograms, but no one has found it. Maybe when it dropped, the metal overheated and burned it all.

content.en: Scientists are finding ways to clean up space junk. They want to keep everyone safe from it. Scientists are also finding ways to clean up space junk. They want to keep everyone safe from it. Maybe you'll see a bright light zooming across the night sky too. Maybe it will be a plane or a shooting star. Or maybe it'll be space junk!
content.tw: 科學家正在尋找清理太空垃圾的方法。他們想讓每個人都免受其害。科學家們也在尋找清理太空垃圾的方法。他們希望保護每個人免受其害。也許你也會看到一道亮光劃過夜空。也許那是一架飛機或一顆流星。又或許，那是太空垃圾！

vocabulary.preface: The bright lights in the night sky may be sparks caused by space debris entering the Earth's atmosphere and burning up.

content.text: 1. junk 垃圾. Did you see that? I sure did! It's amazing, isn't it? My guess is that it's space junk.
2. piece 碎片. Why? Because it seems to have many pieces. Maybe they are parts of a big rocket. That would be so cool!
3. fall 掉落. The pieces may fall on us. That would be big news!
4. hit 撞擊. You're not worried? Not at all. I'm sure they won't hit me. Look, another one is coming! Help!

title: Poland's Elementary Schools Have New Homework Rules

content.en: School's done! It's time to go home and eat dinner! Then it's time to play or chill with your friends. This is your free time! You can do what you want … right?
content.tw: 放學了，該回家吃晚餐。在那之後是你的休閒時間，可以跟朋友一起玩，做任何你想做的事，對吧?

content.en: WRONG! Sorry! You've got homework to do... LOTS of homework!
content.tw: 你錯了! 你還有很多功課要做!

content.en: Kids get homework in many countries. But not in Poland! This country has new rules about homework in elementary school.
content.tw: 很多國家的小朋友都有作業，但波蘭的小朋友沒有，因為對小學作業有新的規定。

content.en: In Poland, elementary school is from Grades 1 to 8. Kids in Grades 1 to 3 get NO homework at all. Kids in Grades 4 to 8 can do homework... if they want. If they don't want to do it, that's okay!
content.tw: 波蘭的小學有八個年級。一到三年級的小朋友沒有回家作業，四到八年級可以選擇要不要做。

content.en: Kids in Poland can do what they want after school. They have lots of free time!
content.tw: 波蘭的小朋友放學後可以做任何他們想做的事。他們有很多休閒時間。

content.en: Poland says its kids can learn better now. Before, they were tired, stressed, and overworked. When kids are very tired, remembering things is difficult. That makes learning very difficult!!
content.tw: 波蘭政府說這樣反而讓小朋友的學習更好。之前他們覺得累、有壓力甚至過度疲勞，無法好好記住知識，讓學習變得很困難。

content.en: Poland says kids won't be tired and overworked now. And kids will be less stressed too. What do you think? Do you want Taiwan to have these homework rules?
content.tw: 波蘭政府表示，現在孩子們將不再感到疲憊和過度勞累，壓力也會減輕。你怎麼看呢？你希望台灣也有這樣的作業規定嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 波蘭的小學生，多半可以自由選擇是不是要做回家功課。

content.text: 1. remember 記得 Remember elementary school? 還記得小學嗎? How can I forget it? 我怎麼會忘記? I had quite a few mean teachers.我碰到好幾個很兇的老師。
2. stressed 有壓力 Did you feel stressed out? 你覺得壓力很大嗎? Yeah, but it was because of my parents. 是啊，不過是因為我爸媽。 They wanted me and my sister to get good grades. 他們要我和姊姊有好成績。
3. free time 自由時間 The only free time we got was after school and before dinner. 我們的自由時間只有在放學後晚飯前。 So you tried to have fun.所以你們儘量玩。
4. lots of 很多 Yeah, how did you know that? 對啊，你怎麼知道? We watched lots and lots of TV, 我們看好多電視，and played with our dogs.還跟小狗玩。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字你可記得? remember記得 stressed有壓力 free time自由時間 lots of很多

2. What makes remembering things difficult?
3. In this story, who gets NO homework at all?

title: From Wild Goats to Pet Goats?

content.en: A small Italian island has about 100 people. It also has about 600 wild goats!
content.tw: 義大利的一座小島有差不多100位居民跟600多隻的野生山羊。

content.en: That's too many wild goats! They are a 'biiiig' problem. There isn't enough food for them! Now they go into people's gardens. They eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner there! Goodbye, beautiful flowers, fruits, and vegetables…
content.tw: 野生山羊真的太多了，島上沒有足夠的食物，牠們只好跑進居民的後院吃三餐，漂亮的花、蔬菜水果都沒了。

content.en: The mayor is asking for help! He wants people to take 500 goats from the island. Maybe these wild goats can become their pet goats!
content.tw: 市長希望大家可以幫助他把500隻山羊帶離這座島，或許這些山羊可以成為他們的寵物。

content.en: Getting a goat is easy. People email the mayor. They say they want a goat. The mayor says okay. Then they go and catch a goat!
content.tw: 要領養山羊很簡單，寄電子郵件給市長說想要一隻，市長同意就可以去抓山羊。

content.en: Wait a minute... The island is one tall mountain. It has no roads! It has no cars! It has many, MANY steps. Donkeys carry things up and down. And... goats are VERY good at running up and down mountains.
content.tw: 等等，這座島是一座高山，山上沒有路也沒有車，只有很多的階梯。驢子可以載物品上下樓梯，山羊也很會爬山。

content.en: The mayor gives people fifteen days to catch a wild goat. Why? Hmmm... Maybe getting a pet goat here isn't easy!
content.tw: 市長給人們十五天的時間來抓一隻野生山羊。為什麼呢？嗯...或許在這裡領養一隻寵物山羊並不容易！

vocabulary.preface: 想要山羊當寵物，看起來困難重重。

content.text:
1. breakfast 早餐。
What's for breakfast tomorrow? 明天早飯吃什麼?
Let's see…Toast, milk and fruit. 我想想，吐司、牛奶跟水果。
Sounds good. 聽起來不錯。

2. vegetable 蔬菜。
And what's for lunch? Just curious. 那中飯呢? 只是好奇。
Maybe some pasta with vegetables. 也許煮點麵條加蔬菜。
Vegetables from our garden? That'll be great! 我們菜園裡的蔬菜嗎? 那很棒!

3. dinner 晚飯。
I won't be home for dinner, though. 不過我不會在家吃晚飯。
I'm going hiking on Xiangshan. 我要去象山健行。

4. up and down 上上下下。
What's the fun of going up and down that hill? 爬上爬下那座山有什麼好玩的?
The weather is so hot. 天氣又這麼熱。
The night view is beautiful! 夜景很漂亮!

vocabulary.postscript: 這些都是常用的單字。breakfast早餐 vegetable蔬菜 dinner晚飯 up and down上上下下

quiz.question: 1. How many wild goats are there on the island?
2. What do the wild goats eat?
3. What do you need to do first to get a goat from the island?

content.en: A young girl was inspired by her older brother and sister. They were doing very well in school. She became excited about doing well in school too!
content.tw: 有一個小女孩她的哥哥姊姊在學校成績優異，她受到啟發，也很希望在學校有所表現。

content.en: The girl became the youngest student at her university. Her classmates didn't know she was 13. She felt like a secret superhero! She studied hard to be a teacher. She finished university when she was 15!
content.tw: 她後來成為大學裡最年輕的學生，同學都沒有發現她才13歲，她覺得自己像個隱藏版的超級英雄。她很用功，希望以後當老師，15歲就從大學畢業。

content.en: But… she wanted to teach. She didn't want her parents to drive her to work. She wanted to drive. But she had to be 16 to get a driver's license.
content.tw: 她雖然想當老師，可是又不願意讓父母開車送她，只能等到16歲拿到駕照。

content.en: The girl got her driver's license and started teaching. At 16, she's the youngest teacher in the U.S.!
content.tw: 女孩拿到駕照後就開始教書，成為美國最年輕的老師。

content.en: She teaches Grade 3. She makes her classes fun! She asks her students to try new things. She tells them to think about what they can do, not what they can't do.
content.tw: 她教小學三年級的學生，她的課很好玩。她也鼓勵學生嘗試新的事物，告訴他們要想想，他們能做什麼，而不是不能做什麼。

content.en: Her students don't think she's a kid. They see her talking with other teachers. They see her driving.
content.tw: 她的學生不認為她是個孩子。他們看到她和其他老師聊天。他們看到她開車。

content.en: This young teacher inspires her students. They try to do and be the best they can. Who inspires you?
content.tw: 這位年輕的老師激勵著她的學生。他們努力做到最好。誰激勵了你呢？

vocabulary.preface: 這個女孩從讀書到當老師，都是最年輕的。

content.text:
1. student 學生
I told my students a joke. 我跟學生講了一個笑話。
But they didn't laugh. 可是他們都沒笑。
What was the joke? 什麼笑話?
"How does the ocean say hello? It waves." 海洋如何說哈囉? 它揮揮手。

2. teach 教學
Maybe you need to teach the word "wave" first. 也許你得先教「海浪」這個字。
I think so, too. 我也覺得。

3. youngest 最年輕
But Annie, my youngest student, asked me to explain.
不過我的年紀最小的學生安妮，有要我解釋。
She's only 9. 她只有九歲。

4. class 班級
A 9-year-old in your grade-6 class? 九歲上你六年級的班?
Yeah, and she's doing very well. 對，而且她表現很好。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天學到的單字你還記得嗎?
student學生
teach教學
youngest最年輕
class班級

2. How old was the girl when she became a teacher?
3. What does the teacher tell her students to think about?

content.en: In Oregon, lots of salmon are NOT born in rivers. These baby fish are born in hatcheries. Workers help them grow. Young fish are safe there.
content.tw: 奧勒岡州有很多鮭魚不是在河裡出生，而是在魚卵孵化場。工作人員把牠們安全的養大。

content.en: When salmon are about a year and a half old, they leave their hatchery. They take a fish taxi!
content.tw: 到了一歲半，這些小魚就會搭計程車，離開孵化場。

content.en: Fish taxis are trucks with a big tank. Hatchery workers put salmon and water in the tank.
content.tw: 鮭魚計程車是裝載巨大魚缸的卡車，工作人員把魚缸裝滿水，把小魚放進去。

content.en: The truck drives the fish to a river. The salmon swim down the river to the ocean. There, they become big and strong.
content.tw: 卡車載小魚到河邊，放進河裡，讓牠們從河流游進大海，長成強壯的大魚。

content.en: One day, a truck was driving near a river. The tank had more than 100,000 salmon in it. The fish were going to a big river.
content.tw: 有一天，一輛裝了十萬條魚苗的卡車要開到河邊。

content.en: But the road was wet. The truck turned and ---oh, no! There was a bad accident!
content.tw: 結果路面濕滑，讓卡車轉彎時出了車禍!

content.en: The driver was okay! But the tank rolled down by the river. Water and many, many salmon came out of the tank!
content.tw: 還好駕駛沒事，但車上的水缸滾到了河邊！裡面的魚苗幾乎都流出來了。

content.en: Some did not live... But 77,000 salmon were very lucky! They fell into the river and swam away!
content.tw: 有的鮭魚沒有活下來，但還是有7萬7千隻的鮭魚很幸運地掉進河裡游走了。

content.en: Go, fish! Swim to the ocean!
content.tw: 去吧，魚兒！游向大海吧！

vocabulary.preface: 鮭魚計程車出了車禍，讓它的乘客通通掉進了河裡。

content.text:
1. fish 魚。
Let’s get a pet. 我們養個寵物吧。
Good idea! A dog or a cat? 好主意，養狗還是養貓?
I think we should get some fish.我覺得應該養魚。

2. swim 游泳。
Fish? You can’t cuddle a fish! 魚?你沒辦法跟魚抱抱。
But I enjoy watching them swim. 但是我喜歡看牠們游泳。It’s so relaxing.讓人很放鬆。

3. water 水。
Okay, so how should we start? 好吧，該怎麼開始?
Buy a fish tank and put water in it. 買一個魚缸，放水進去。

4. lucky 幸運的。
Yeah, and I’ll find two pairs of colorful fish.對，我去找兩對彩色的魚。
If we’re lucky, we’ll get baby fish! 我們幸運的話，還會有小貝比魚!

vocabulary.postscript: Do you like fish as pets? fish魚 swim游泳 water水 lucky幸運的
